thread.title: Football: Clear Brook’s Allison gets first win in 22-14 victory over Lake
thread.title_full: Football: Clear Brook’s Allison gets first win in 22-14 victory over Lake

title: Football: Clear Brook’s Allison gets first win in 22-14 victory over Lake
text:
LEAGUE CITY -- Clear Brook scored 19 second-quarter points to surge into the lead and then held off Clear Lake for a 22-14 win in a District 24-6A football game Friday night. 
The win was the first career head coaching victory for first-year Wolverine head coach Mike Allison. Advertisement 
Lake took a 7-0 lead on Ahmad Harris’s 1-yard run in the first quarter before Brandon Taylor took over for Clear Brook in the second period. 
Taylor scored on runs of 16 and 29 yards as Brook took a 12-7 lead. Taylor then connected with Caleb Chapman on a 5-yard TD pass as time expired in the second quarter for a 19-7 cushion. 
After a scoreless third quarter, Lake pulled within 19-14 when Corey Flanagan caught a 16-yard touchdown pass from Will Smith with 10:56 left in the game. 
The only other scoring after that was Aidan Cupples’ 25-yard field goal for Brook with 1:46 left. 
Smith completed 27 of 47 passes for 219 yards for the Falcons, now 1-5 overall and 0-3 in district. Matt Nance had 11 receptions for Lake for 53 yards while Harris rushed 30 times for 86 yards. 
Taylor led Brook with 21 carries for 195 yards. 
The win improved the Wolverines to 1-5 overall and 1-2 in district.
